Rails Real-Time Form Validation Plug-in

Written By Vince Puzzella

Uses AJAX (requires prototype.js!!!) and your model validation rules to validate form data in real-time. Invalid form fields are then dynamically embedded into span elements which can be stylized using CSS.

I look forward to your comments, suggestions and critisism. Please, have your say in the forums!

Note to FireFox users: The outlines don't look right, I know. CSS gurus, please help!

Usage:

Download and extract to your vendor/plugins directory

In your controller:

include UIEnhancements::RealtimeValidation
helper :RealtimeValidation
realtime_validation_for(:the_form_id, :the_model)

In your view, after a form:

<%= realtime_validation_for :the_form_id, :the_model %>

In your CSS (example):

.fieldWithoutErrors,
.fieldWithErrors
{
    outline-width: 1px;
    outline-color: white;
    outline-style: solid;

    /* !!HACK!! IE will not use this because it does not understand !important.  Border is not needed for firefox, so make it 0px!*/
    border-width: 0px !important;    
    /*for IE!*/
    border-width: 1px;
    border-color: white;
    border-style: solid;
}
.fieldWithErrors
{
    outline-color: red;
    	    
    /*for IE!*/
    border-color: red;
}

Known to work with:

  • Ruby 1.8.4
  • Rails 1.1.2
  • FireFox 1.5
  • IE 6

Known issues:

  • Multi-param form feilds (I.E: date_select)
    • You must wrap the multi-param fields with a span element. The span element must have an id of "model_name_attribute_name".
  • The CSS in this example doesn't look great in Firefox. If someone has a suggestion, please let me know!
  • Does not support button groups yet (I.E: Radio buttons).

That's it, enjoy!
